pullRequest.body:
Defines left/right lifting property wrt a `MorphismProperty` and shows basic closure properties (retracts, pullback/pushout, composition etc.).

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

### PR summary [e496339c99](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19135/commits/e496339c99b7ffffb679084dd25b6ec297737d21)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.MorphismProperty.Lifting` (new file)|589|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsStableUnderCobaseChange.isomorphisms`
`+ fac_left`
`+ fac_right`
`+ lift`
`+ liftOfRetractLeft`
`+ liftOfRetractRight`
`+ llp`
`+ llp.ContainsIdentities`
`+ llp.IsMultiplicative`
`+ llp.IsStableUnderCobaseChange`
`+ llp.IsStableUnderComposition`
`+ llp.IsStableUnderRetracts`
`+ llp.RespectsIso`
`+ rlp`
`+ rlp.ContainsIdentities`
`+ rlp.IsMultiplicative`
`+ rlp.IsStableUnderBaseChange`
`+ rlp.IsStableUnderComposition`
`+ rlp.IsStableUnderRetracts`
`+ rlp.RespectsIso`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

It could be advisable to split this PR into two:
* one for the basic `Retract` API
* one for the improvements to the `HasLiftingProperty` API I have suggested and the application to `rlp/llp`.

> It could be advisable to split this PR into two:
> 
>     * one for the basic `Retract` API
> 
>     * one for the improvements to the `HasLiftingProperty` API I have suggested and the application to `rlp/llp`.

I think that's a good call. I'll split the PR.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19233~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
As this contains data, this should not be named `IsRetract`. Also, this notion should be defined in any category, not just the `Arrow` category.
(Maybe use an abbrev `RetractArrow {X Y Z W : C} (f : X ⟶ Y) (g : Z ⟶ W) : Prop` for the arrow variant.)
Basic notions about retracts could go in a file like `CategoryTheory.Retract`.

Arguably, both `Llp` or `llp` would be ok, but in mathlib, we have considered morphism properties more as terms in `MorphismProperty` rather than a type, so that `llp/rlp` would fit more our current use.
It would be nice to break this into an auxiliary lemma `HasLiftingProperty g f : HasLiftingProperty g' f` assuming `Retract g' g`.
You may add `RespectsIso`, and `IsMultiplicative` instances.
You may also add a `IsStableUnderProductsOfShape` lemma (and also the dual `IsStableUnderCoproductsOfShape`, even though the latter is not defined yet in `MorphismProperty.Limits`).
This suggests there are missing lemmas in the `Retract` API.

The `HasLiftingProperty` API should be improved in order to provide a choice of a lifting and both `fac_left/fac_right` lemmas. This could defined as `CommSq.lift` under a suitable `[HasLiftingProperty i p]` assumption.

```suggestion
lemma retract_left : h.i.left ≫ h.r.left = 𝟙 X := Arrow.hom.congr_left h.retract
```

```suggestion
lemma retract_right : h.i.right ≫ h.r.right = 𝟙 Y := Arrow.hom.congr_right h.retract
```

```suggestion
lemma i_w : h.i.left ≫ g = f ≫ h.i.right := h.i.w
```
Also, all these lemmas should get the `reassoc` attribute.

```suggestion
lemma r_w : h.r.left ≫ f = g ≫ h.r.right := h.r.w
```

```suggestion
lemma fac : h.i.left ≫ g ≫ h.r.right = f := by
```

```suggestion
lemma of_retract {P : MorphismProperty C} [P.IsStableUnderRetracts]
```

```suggestion
  of_retract {X Y Z W : C} {f : X ⟶ Y} {g : Z ⟶ W} (h : RetractArrow f g) (hg : P g) : P f
```

At some point, we may want to add a class `IsRetract` (I am not so sure), but the version with data should be a structure only:
```suggestion
structure Retract (X Y : C) where
```

Some basic API seems necessary (import `CategoryTheory.EpiMono`):
```suggestion
namespace Retract

attribute [reassoc (attr := simp)] retract

variable {X Y : C} (h : Retract X Y)

@[simps] def splitEpi : SplitEpi h.r where
  section_ := h.i

@[simps] def splitMono : SplitMono h.i where
  retraction := h.r

instance : IsSplitEpi h.r := ⟨⟨h.splitEpi⟩⟩
instance : IsSplitMono h.i := ⟨⟨h.splitMono⟩⟩

end Retract
```
And then, similar definitions and instances for the `_left/_right` variants should be introduced in the `RetractArrow`.

Following my suggestions above, the proof becomes:
```suggestion
instance IsStableUnderRetracts.monomorphisms :
    (monomorphisms C).IsStableUnderRetracts where
  of_Retract {_ _ _ _ f g} h (hg : Mono g) := ⟨fun α β hαβ ↦ by
    rw [← cancel_mono h.i.left, ← cancel_mono g, Category.assoc, Category.assoc,
      h.leftSqComm, reassoc_of% hαβ]⟩
```
(Then, it would be nice to add also the case of epimorphisms and isomorphisms.)

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory): left and right lifting properties
